pageContext.content:
I am a professional artist living in Herefordshire, England UK.

The majority of my work is of the Herefordshire landscape, not just the rivers and streams but buildings in villages and towns, capturing the character and style of bygone architecture. Several of my paintings, with timber framed houses and buildings of immense beauty have been produced from old black and white photographs, as the scenes depicted no longer exist.

I have had my paintings exhibited in over sixty venues as well as having prints and cards on permanent display in shops and galleries, and now I am able to offer my work via this website.

featured.description:
The Clock Tower is a memorial to the local poet Elizabeth Barrett Browning opened in 1896. In 1938 it was re-opened by the poet laureate John Masefield as a public library. The library was re-located in 2015 and is now undergoing changes to make it into a recording studio, a performance space for the arts and crafts and a youth cafe'.

Original watercolour, image size 14" x 10".

Mounted to fit frame size 20" x 16".

Price £245

A signed, embossed limited edition print is available £40.

featured.description:
Ross is a small town, south of Hereford, hilly, but so interesting with a network of narrow lanes off the main roads. The 17th century Church of Saint Mary is dominent on the sky line with the 19th century mock-Gothic walls and Gazebo Tower Folly in front, and admire pastel-hued dwellings tumbling down the hillside to the river.

Original watercolour, image size 14" x 10".

Mounted to fit frame size 20" x 16".

Price £245

A signed, embossed limited edition print is available £45.
featured.metaDescription: Watercolour Painting of Ross-on-Wye, Herefordshire. By Herefordshire artist David J. Fry.
featured.paypalEmbedCode: P821 Ross-on-Wye, Herefordshire.
featured.title: Ross-on-Wye, Herefordshire.

featured.description:
The Brockhampton Estate is located on the edge of Bringsty Common near the town of Bromyard in Herefordshire. The timber framed manor house dates back to the 14th century, is surrounded by a moat and is entered by a gatehouse at the front of the house. It is surrounded by 1,000 acres of farm and parkland and 700 acres of woodland. Brockhampton Estate was bequeathed to the National Trust in 1946 by Colonel John Lutley, in whose family it had been for more than twenty generations.

Original oil on canvas, image size 20" x 16".

Price £345

A signed, embossed, limited edition print, mounted to fit frame size 14"x 11"

Price £40.
featured.metaDescription: Oil painting of Lower Brockhampton, Herefordshire. By Herefordshire artist David J. Fry

featured.description:
New Quay is a sea side town on Cardigan Bay with a harbour and large sandy beaches, it lies on the Ceredigian coastal path. There is a population of bottlenose dolphins that live in Cardigan Bay. There is a strong association with the poet Dylan Thomas and his play Under Milk Wood.

Original watercolour, image size 9.75" x 8.5".

Mounted to fit frame size 20" x 16".

Price £245

A signed, embossed limited edition print is available £40.
